top.title: Assay offices call for reform of Hallmarking law
top.snippet:
The four UK Assay Offices have issued a joint open letter to MPs urging action in reforming the Hallmarking Act 1973. This open letter is fully supported by the National Association of Jewellers (NAJ). Hallmarking remains a cornerstone of consumer protection, providing independent assurance of precious metal quality and safeguarding public trust in jewellery and […]
The post Assay offices call for reform of Hallmarking law appeared first on Professional Jeweller.
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: The UK Assay Offices and the National Association of Jewellers are calling for reform of the Hallmarking Act 1973 to ensure consumer protection and maintain public trust in the jewellery industry.

top.title: Richemont UK outperforms rival groups with 5% rise in sales
top.snippet:
Richemont‘s watch and jewellery business has generated record sales in the UK with turnover rising 5.3% to £277 million in 2024-25. The group’s latest accounts cover the 12 months to March 1 2025. Operating profit surged by 155% to £32 million. The results cover retail and wholesale for jewellery and watchmakers, but do not include […]
The post Richemont UK outperforms rival groups with 5% rise in sales appeared first on Professional Jeweller.
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: Richemont UK's watch and jewellery business achieved record sales, with a 5.3% increase in turnover to £277 million in 2024-25, along with a significant 155% rise in operating profit to £32 million.

top.title: The Goldsmiths’ Centre to spotlights emerging talent in New Year
top.snippet:
The Goldsmiths’ Centre is set to hold Spotlighting Getting Started, a free public exhibition championing the work of 15 emerging jewellers and silversmiths. From 12 January to 18 February 2026, the exhibition will showcase over 50 independent designers utilising a range of contemporary practices. Visitors can explore techniques from Japonisme-inspired motifs and ocean forms captured […]
The post The Goldsmiths’ Centre to spotlights emerging talent in New Year appeared first on Professional Jewel...
top.aiSummary: The Goldsmiths’ Centre will host an exhibition called Spotlighting Getting Started featuring 15 emerging jewellers and silversmiths showcasing contemporary practices from January 12 to February 18, 2026. The exhibition will highlight over 50 independent designers using various techniques such as Japonisme-inspired motifs and ocean forms.

top.title: Louis V. Gerstner, Who Revived a Faltering IBM in the ’90s, Dies at 83
top.snippet: Installed as an outsider, he engineered a comeback, shifting the company’s focus from a waning mainframe computer business toward consulting and services.
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
Louis V. Gerstner, the former CEO of IBM, passed away at the age of 83. He successfully led the company's transformation from mainframe computers to consulting and services in the 1990s.
